page.title: 13RESIDENTIAL AREAS (PART 1)
page.content: The area represents most periods of housing styles this century.On Horning- low Rd. there are Victorian terraced houses,the land behind these was,until 1930,open fields.Much of this is now built up.The two main roads,Rolleston Rd. and Tutbury Rd.,show examples of ribbon development,many of the houses being detached and dating from app.1930 They have features such as mock Tudor panelling and stained glass in windows. They have large rear gardens and small front gardens.There are 4 main areas of housing.To the west of Calais Rd. are modern houses set on curved roads and cul-de-sacs.Many houses have been extended in some way.To the east of Calais Rd. is an area of council houses built in the 1950's.There are semi's, blocks of 4 and some terraces. {MORE ON PAGE 14}
